title: Evaluating the Effectiveness of Flipped Learning and Blended Learning: Social Statistics Practitioner Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental statistical knowledge and understanding of social research methodologies
context.additional_context: Short-Intensive Program for Practicing Professionals to Enhance Statistically Informed Thinking for Practical Application, Evaluating the Effectiveness of Flipped Learning and Blended Learning

learning_goals: Learners explain flipped learning and blended learning principles and analyze practical application cases
Learners evaluate problem-solving strategies utilizing flipped learning and blended learning in social statistics analysis processes
A mixed-methods research approach is applied to quantitatively measure learning effectiveness indicators (engagement, inclusivity).
Learning outcome data is visualized and interpreted using R statistical software.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
